CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 14+8;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the GPE area .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was awarded a Commemorative “ DATE ” Medal ( bestowed upon persons who distinguished themselves when defending the freedom and independence of GPE during the period DATE ) . By the Presidential order of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was awarded the Medal of Founding Volunteers of the Lithuanian Army .

CARDINAL . On DATE a special governmental commission ( “ the Commission ” ) found that the applicant had been a “ former secret collaborator ” ( slapta bendradarbiavęs asmuo ) under the Law on registering , confession , entry into records and protection of persons who have admitted to secret collaboration with special services of the former GPE , and decided to publish this information in the “ Official Gazette ” ( PERSON žinios ) .

CARDINAL . The applicant brought proceedings before ORG requesting it to quash the ORG ’s conclusion as to his former collaboration . On DATE the court partly granted the applicant ’s claim , establishing that there had been a lack of evidence of the applicant having been a ORG collaborator .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the lower court ’s decision . It was found that the applicant had indeed been a ORG collaborator while working as a sports journalist and travelling abroad in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Commission published information in the “ Official Gazette ” to the effect that , in the past , the applicant had collaborated with the special services of the former GPE , namely with the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was dismissed from his post as an official at ORG of ORG . The decree by which he was dismissed stipulated that the reason for the dismissal was the information regarding his collaboration , which the ORG had published on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant again challenged the ORG ’s conclusions in its decision of CARDINAL DATE as being null and void . On DATE ORG dismissed the action on procedural grounds , finding that there had been a final court decision on the issue . The case was discontinued .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG reopened the proceedings to have the evidence better examined and to establish guidelines for a common judicial practice in similar future cases .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the merits of the applicant ’s complaints , dismissing his request to quash the decision of ORG of DATE . ORG found that the lower courts had reasonably concluded that the applicant had secretly collaborated with the secret services of the former GPE . The court noted that the applicant ’s rights in examining the evidence and questioning the witnesses had not been curtailed . That decision was final .

On an unspecified date the applicant submitted a request to ORG seeking the reopening of the procedure , alleging violations of material legal norms in the decisions in his case . On DATE , the court dismissed his request as unfounded .
CARDINAL . The applicant alleged that he had been disbarred from practising as a barrister as a result of the impugned domestic decisions .

CARDINAL . The PERSON on registering , confession , entry into records and protection of persons who have admitted to secret collaboration with special services of the former GPE ( hereafter “ the Law ” ) was enacted on DATE , and came into effect on DATE . The PERSON provided for the creation of a special governmental Commission responsible for the assessment of the activities of persons who had secretly collaborated with such services and the registration of those persons as “ former secret collaborators ” . The PERSON , in so far as relevant in this case , reads as follows :

“ CARDINAL . The provisions of the PERSON on ORG , whose aim is to create a system of national security protecting the ORG and its population , human and ORG rights and freedoms , and also personal safety , shall be implemented by the present PERSON , providing protection against the influence , blackmail and recruitment , or attempts to draw into any illegal activity , by the special services of foreign GPE . The LAW shall also ensure the implementation of the ORG ’s right to apply the principle of loyalty and trustworthiness to civil servants and other employees of ORG government and administration , local government , national defence , the interior affairs system , ORG , courts , ORG , the diplomatic service , customs , ORG controlled institutions and other ORG institutions which implement control and management , to attorneys and notaries , and to employees of banks and other credit institutions , or in strategic economic entities , communication systems , protection services and structures thereof , and in other structures providing detective services . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . A person , who has secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE means ... a person ... who has actually and deliberately carried out the tasks and assignments of the special services of the former GPE according to a written or unwritten commitment to collaborate in secret , where the activity is not regulated by statutory regulations or labour laws ( agent , resident , confidant , retainer of conspiracy quarters , retainer of a rendezvous flat , non - staff operational employee or other person who has secretly collaborated with the secret services of the former GPE ) . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . A ... Commission ... shall be established to assess the activities of persons who secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE and to adopt decisions whether to include persons in a report or publication of data concerning secret collaboration . ...
CARDINAL . Pursuant to the present ORG shall :
CARDINAL ) assess the activities of persons involved in secret collaboration with the special services of the former GPE ;
CARDINAL ) adopt decisions concerning the inclusion in the report of persons who have admitted to secret collaboration with the special services of the former GPE ;
CARDINAL ) adopt decisions concerning the publication of information about the secret collaboration of persons with the special services of the former GPE , in the instances specified in LAW ;
CARDINAL ) ensuring total personal confidentiality , shall encode the secret information transferred to the ORG and adopt decisions concerning the provision of information for research work ; ... ”
“ In accordance with the present PERSON , ORG shall : ...

CARDINAL ) upon the request of persons who have admitted to collaboration in secret with the special services of the former GPE , employ measures to protect them from blackmail and recruitment attempts or efforts to involve them in any illegal activity ; ... ”

“ CARDINAL . Persons who have secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE must present themselves within DATE of the registration and confession acceptance date , as announced by the ORG in the “ Official Gazette ” , to register and voluntarily confess in writing , to ORG , to have secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE , reveal all of the information known to them concerning the activities of the special services , and hand in the documents or objects linked to the special services of the former GPE . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . Persons who have secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE shall be entered in the records by a decision of the Commission if they have voluntarily confessed to having secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE , and have submitted all the information within their knowledge in connection with the activity of the special services .

CARDINAL . The fact of confession and the data submitted by the person who has confessed shall comprise information which constitutes a ORG secret and which shall be classified as secret and used and declassified according to the procedure established by law ... ”
LAW Protection of persons who have confessed and instances of information publication

“ CARDINAL . Information supplied by persons who have been registered , have confessed and have been entered in the records , and the data regarding them , shall be classified and stored according to the procedure established by law .

CARDINAL . Persons indicated in paragraph CARDINAL of this Article shall inform ORG if they experience blackmail and recruitment offers or attempts to draw them into any illegal activities , and ORG , on the basis of a request by the persons who have made confessions , shall take measures to protect them and to uncover criminal activity . The entry of persons in records and the information submitted by them shall be declassified if these persons have been convicted by a final judgment of having committed actions that have been acknowledged as acts against humanity , war or crimes of genocide , and by other instances established by law for the declassification of classified information . ...

CARDINAL . The information regarding secret collaboration with the special services of the former GPE shall be published in the ‘ Official Gazette’ in those instances where a person who had secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE has failed to admit within DATE of the beginning of registration and reception of confessions announced by ORG , to having secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE , and also if he has furnished false information about himself , other persons and the activities of the special services , or has concealed such information . The person who secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE shall be given written notice of the decision adopted by the Commission to publicise such information . He may appeal against this decision to the administrative court , within DATE of receipt of such notice . The implementation of the decision to make the information public shall be suspended until the court judgment becomes effective . ”

“ CARDINAL . Persons who have secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE , whose data has been made public according to the procedure established in DATE of the present PERSON , for a period of DATE from the date of publication , may not be employed as teachers in educational institutions , educators or heads of such institutions , occupy positions requiring the carrying of a weapon , or work as Republic of GPE civil servants or other employees of ORG government and administration , municipal authorities , national defence , the interior affairs system , customs , the Prosecutor ’s office , courts , ORG , the diplomatic service , ORG controlled and other ORG institutions engaged in control and supervision , as attorneys and notaries , or as employees of banks and other credit institutions , or in strategic economic functions , communications systems , protection services and structures thereof and other structures providing detective services .

CARDINAL . In the event that the data concerning persons who secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE has been published in the ‘ Official Gazette’ or in other mass media by decision of the Commission , an employer or his representative must , no later than DATE following the publication of this information , dismiss the employee from his job , without paying him severance pay ...

CARDINAL . Should the published information regarding a person who secretly collaborated with the special services of the former GPE concern a person who is engaged in legal practice , ORG of GPE shall revoke the decision to accredit the person as a lawyer . At the conclusion of a DATE term , the person shall have the right to be accredited as a lawyer in accordance with the procedure established by law . ”
